meanings.definition: The state or quality of being dirty.
meanings.sent1: The dirtinesses of the room were evident from the muddy footprints on the floor.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't stand the dirtinesses of the old abandoned house.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful antics only added to the dirtinesses of the kitchen floor.
meanings.sent4: The dirtinesses of the city streets mirrored the neglect of its residents.
meanings.sent5: The dirtinesses of the pond made it impossible to see the bottom.

meanings.definition: The presence of dirt or filth.
meanings.sent1: The dirtinesses on his hands showed he had been working in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The dirtinesses in the alley made it clear it hadn't been cleaned in a while.
meanings.sent3: The children's laughter echoed through the dirtinesses of the playground.
meanings.sent4: The dirtinesses of the riverbanks revealed the pollution in the water.
meanings.sent5: The dirtinesses of the kitchen sink attracted unwanted pests.

meanings.definition: The act of making something dirty.
meanings.sent1: Her constant touching of the painting resulted in the dirtinesses of its surface.
meanings.sent2: The dirtinesses caused by the construction workers left a mess in the hallway.
meanings.sent3: The dirtinesses of the dog's paws left marks all over the clean floor.
meanings.sent4: The dirtinesses of the children's hands made a mess of the freshly painted walls.
meanings.sent5: The dirtinesses of the muddy shoes ruined the pristine white carpet.
